library_of_life.registry package

Submodules

library_of_life.registry.collections module

class library_of_life.registry.collections.Collections(use_caching=False, cache_name='collections_cache', backend='sqlite', expire_after=3600, auth_type='basic', client_id=None, client_secret=None, token_url=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for interacting with the collections section of the Registry API.

endpoint

The endpoint for this section of the API.

export_collections(data_format='TSV', content_types: str | None = None, preservtion_types: str | None = None, accession_status: str | None = None, personal_collection: bool | None = None, code: str | None = None, name: str | None = None, alternative_code: str | None = None, contact: str | None = None, machine_tag_namespace: str | None = None, machine_tag_name: str | None = None, machine_tag_value: str | None = None, identifier_type: str | None = None, identifier: str | None = None, country: str | None = None, gbif_region: str | None = None, city: str | None = None, fuzzy_name: str | None = None, active: bool | None = None, master_source_type: str | None = None, number_specimens: str | None = None, display_on_nhc_portal: bool | None = None, replaced_by: str | None = None, occurrence_count: str | None = None, type_specimen_count: str | None = None, institution_key: str | None = None, sort_by: str | None = None, sort_order: str | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns a list of all current collections (deleted collections are not listed).

Parameters:

  • data_format (str) – Available values: TSV and CSV. Default is TSV.

  • content_types (str) – Optional. Content type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example contentType=PALEONTOLOGICAL_OTHER&contentType=EARTH_PLANETARY_MINERALS. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • preservation_types (str) – Optional. Preservation type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example preservationType=SAMPLE_CRYOPRESERVED&preservationType=SAMPLE_FLUID_PRESERVED. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • accession_status (str) – Optional. Accession status of a GrSciColl collection. Available values : INSTITUTIONAL, PROJECT.

  • personal_collection (bool) – Optional. Flag for personal GRSciColl collections. True or False.

  • code (str) – Optional. Code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • name (str) – Optional. Name of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • alternative_code (str) – Optional. Alternative code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • contact (str) – Optional. Filters collections and institutions whose contacts contain the person key specified.

  • machine_tag_namespace (str) – Optional: Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • identifier_type (str) – Optional. An identifier type for the identifier parameter. Available values : URL, LSID, HANDLER, DOI, UUID, FTP, URI, UNKNOWN, GBIF_PORTAL, GBIF_NODE, GBIF_PARTICIPANT, GRSCICOLL_ID, GRSCICOLL_URI, IH_IRN, ROR, GRID, CITES, SYMBIOTA_UUID, WIKIDATA, NCBI_BIOCOLLECTION.

  • identifier (str) – Optional. An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

  • country (str) – Optional. Filters by country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • gbif_region (str) – Optional. Filters by a gbif region. Available values : AFRICA, ASIA, EUROPE, NORTH_AMERICA, OCEANIA, LATIN_AMERICA, ANTARCTICA.

  • city (str) – Optional. Filters by the city of the address. It searches in both the physical and the mailing address.

  • fuzzy_name (str) – Optional. It searches by name fuzzily so the parameter doesn’t have to be the exact name.

  • active (bool) – Optional. Active status of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • master_source_type (str) – Optional. The master source type of a GRSciColl institution or collection. Available values : GRSCICOLL, GBIF_REGISTRY, IH.

  • number_specimens (str) – Optional. Number of specimens. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • display_on_nhc_portal (bool) – Optional. Flag to show this record in the NHC portal.

  • replaced_by (str) – Optional. Key of the entity that replaced another entity.

  • occurrence_count (str) – Optional. Count of occurrences linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • type_specimen_count (str) – Optional. Count of type specimens linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • institution_key (str) – Optional. Keys of institutions to filter by.

  • sort_by (str) – Optional. Field to sort the results by. It only supports the fields contained in the enum. Available values : NUMBER_SPECIMENS.

  • sort_order (str) – Optional. Sort order to use with the sortBy parameter. Available values : ASC, DESC.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a list of current collections.

Return type:

dict

get_collection_by_key(key)[source]

Returns details of a single collection matching the given key.

Parameters:

key (str) – The key of the entity (dataset, organization, network etc.).

Returns:

Returns details of a single collection.

Return type:

dict

list_all_collections(content_types: str | None = None, preservtion_types: str | None = None, accession_status: str | None = None, personal_collection: bool | None = None, code: str | None = None, name: str | None = None, alternative_code: str | None = None, contact: str | None = None, machine_tag_namespace: str | None = None, machine_tag_name: str | None = None, machine_tag_value: str | None = None, identifier_type: str | None = None, identifier: str | None = None, country: str | None = None, gbif_region: str | None = None, city: str | None = None, fuzzy_name: str | None = None, active: bool | None = None, master_source_type: str | None = None, number_specimens: str | None = None, display_on_nhc_portal: bool | None = None, replaced_by: str | None = None, occurrence_count: str | None = None, type_specimen_count: str | None = None, institution_key: str | None = None, sort_by: str | None = None, sort_order: str | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns a list of all current collections (deleted collections are not listed).

Parameters:

  • content_types (str) – Optional. Content type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example contentType=PALEONTOLOGICAL_OTHER&contentType=EARTH_PLANETARY_MINERALS. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • preservation_types (str) – Optional. Preservation type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example preservationType=SAMPLE_CRYOPRESERVED&preservationType=SAMPLE_FLUID_PRESERVED. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • accession_status (str) – Optional. Accession status of a GrSciColl collection. Available values : INSTITUTIONAL, PROJECT.

  • personal_collection (bool) – Optional. Flag for personal GRSciColl collections. True or False.

  • code (str) – Optional. Code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • name (str) – Optional. Name of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • alternative_code (str) – Optional. Alternative code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • contact (str) – Optional. Filters collections and institutions whose contacts contain the person key specified.

  • machine_tag_namespace (str) – Optional: Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • identifier_type (str) – Optional. An identifier type for the identifier parameter. Available values : URL, LSID, HANDLER, DOI, UUID, FTP, URI, UNKNOWN, GBIF_PORTAL, GBIF_NODE, GBIF_PARTICIPANT, GRSCICOLL_ID, GRSCICOLL_URI, IH_IRN, ROR, GRID, CITES, SYMBIOTA_UUID, WIKIDATA, NCBI_BIOCOLLECTION.

  • identifier (str) – Optional. An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

  • country (str) – Optional. Filters by country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • gbif_region (str) – Optional. Filters by a gbif region. Available values : AFRICA, ASIA, EUROPE, NORTH_AMERICA, OCEANIA, LATIN_AMERICA, ANTARCTICA.

  • city (str) – Optional. Filters by the city of the address. It searches in both the physical and the mailing address.

  • fuzzy_name (str) – Optional. It searches by name fuzzily so the parameter doesn’t have to be the exact name.

  • active (bool) – Optional. Active status of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • master_source_type (str) – Optional. The master source type of a GRSciColl institution or collection. Available values : GRSCICOLL, GBIF_REGISTRY, IH.

  • number_specimens (str) – Optional. Number of specimens. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • display_on_nhc_portal (bool) – Optional. Flag to show this record in the NHC portal.

  • replaced_by (str) – Optional. Key of the entity that replaced another entity.

  • occurrence_count (str) – Optional. Count of occurrences linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • type_specimen_count (str) – Optional. Count of type specimens linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • institution_key (str) – Optional. Keys of institutions to filter by.

  • sort_by (str) – Optional. Field to sort the results by. It only supports the fields contained in the enum. Available values : NUMBER_SPECIMENS.

  • sort_order (str) – Optional. Sort order to use with the sortBy parameter. Available values : ASC, DESC.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a list of current collections.

Return type:

dict

library_of_life.registry.datasets module

class library_of_life.registry.datasets.Datasets(use_caching=False, cache_name='datasets_cache', backend='sqlite', expire_after=3600, auth_type='basic', client_id=None, client_secret=None, token_url=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for interacting with the datasets section of the Registry API.

endpoint

endpoint for this section of the API.

create_new_dataset(username=None, password=None, dataset=None)[source]

Creates a new dataset. Note contacts, endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments and metadata descriptions must be added in subsequent requests.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The user’s password.

  • dataset (dict) – The dataset to be created. See this endpoint’s docs for the proper format.

Returns:

None

export_dataset_search(data_format='TSV', dataset_type: str | None = None, subtype: str | None = None, publishing_org: str | None = None, hosting_org: str | None = None, keyword: str | None = None, decade: int | None = None, publishing_country: str | None = None, hosting_country: str | None = None, license: str | None = None, project_id: str | None = None, taxon_key: int | None = None, record_count: str | None = None, modified_date: str | None = None, doi: str | None = None, network_key: str | None = None, endorsing_node_key: str | None = None, installation_key: str | None = None, endpoint_type: str | None = None, query: str | None = None)[source]

Returns contents of datasets matching the search parameters, in TSV or CSV format. Full-text search across all datasets. Results are ordered by relevance.

Parameters:

  • data_format (str) – Format of the exported file. Default is TSV and other supported value is CSV.

  • dataset_type (str) – The primary type of the dataset. Available values : OCCURRENCE, CHECKLIST, METADATA, SAMPLING_EVENT, MATERIAL_ENTITY.

  • subtype (str) – The sub-type of the dataset. Available values : TAXONOMIC_AUTHORITY, NOMENCLATOR_AUTHORITY, INVENTORY_THEMATIC, INVENTORY_REGIONAL, GLOBAL_SPECIES_DATASET, DERIVED_FROM_OCCURRENCE, SPECIMEN, OBSERVATION.

  • publishing_org (str) – Filters datasets by their publishing organization UUID key.

  • hosting_org (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization UUID key.

  • keyword (str) – Filters datasets by a case insensitive plain text keyword. The search is done on the merged collection of tags, the dataset keywordCollections and temporalCoverages.

  • decade (int) – Filters datasets by their temporal coverage broken down to decades. Decades are given as a full year, e.g. 1880, 1960, 2000, etc, and will return datasets wholly contained in the decade as well as those that cover the entire decade or more. Facet by decade to get the break down, i.e. facet=DECADE&limit=0.

  • publishing_country (str) – Filters datasets by their owning organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • hosting_countrg (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • license (str) – The dataset’s licence. Available values : CC0_1_0, CC_BY_4_0, CC_BY_NC_4_0, UNSPECIFIED, UNSUPPORTED.

  • project_id (str) – Filter or facet based on the project ID of a given dataset. A dataset can have a project id if it is the result of a project. multiple datasets can have the same project id. Example : AA003-AA003311F.

  • taxon_key (int) – A taxon key from the GBIF backbone.

  • record_count (int) – Number of records of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 100,*.

  • modified_date (str) – Date when the dataset was modified the last time. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 2022-05-01,*.

  • doi (str) – A DOI identifier.

  • network_key (str) – Network associated to a dataset.

  • endorsing_node_key (str) – Node key that endorsed this dataset’s publisher.

  • installation_key (str) – Key (uuid) of the installation that hosts the dataset.

  • endpoint_type (str) – Type of the endpoint of the dataset. Available values : EML, FEED, WFS, WMS, TCS_RDF, TCS_XML, DWC_ARCHIVE, DIGIR, DIGIR_MANIS, TAPIR, BIOCASE, BIOCASE_XML_ARCHIVE, OAI_PMH, COLDP, CAMTRAP_DP, OTHER.

  • query (str) – Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

Returns:

A TSV or CSV format text content containing the datasets matching search criteria.

Return type:

string

get_dataset_by_doi(prefix, suffix, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns a dataset matching the given doi.

Arg:

prefix (str): Plain DOI prefix (before the slash). Example : 10.15468. suffix (str): Plain DOI suffix (after the slash). Example : igasai. limit (int): Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted. offset (int): Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a dataset.

Return type:

dict

key (str): The key (uuid) of the entity (dataset, organization, network etc.).

list_datasets(country: str | None = None, dataset_type: str | None = None, identifier_type: str | None = None, identifier: str | None = None, machine_tag_namespace: str | None = None, machine_tag_name: str | None = None, machine_tag_value: str | None = None, modified: dict | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns a list of all current datasets.

Parameters:

  • country (str) – Optional. The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country publishing the dataset. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • dataset_type (str) – Optional. The primary type of the dataset. Available values : OCCURRENCE, CHECKLIST, METADATA, SAMPLING_EVENT, MATERIAL_ENTITY.

  • identifier_type (str) – Optional. An identifier type for the identifier parameter. Available values : URL, LSID, HANDLER, DOI, UUID, FTP, URI, UNKNOWN, GBIF_PORTAL, GBIF_NODE, GBIF_PARTICIPANT, GRSCICOLL_ID, GRSCICOLL_URI, IH_IRN, ROR, GRID, CITES, SYMBIOTA_UUID, WIKIDATA, NCBI_BIOCOLLECTION

  • identifier (str) – Optional. An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

  • machine_tag_namespace (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • modified (dict) – Optional. The modified date of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘’ can be used as a wildcard, e.g.:modified=2023-04-01,

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing list of current datasets.

Return type:

dict

search_datasets(dataset_type: str | None = None, subtype: str | None = None, publishing_org: str | None = None, hosting_org: str | None = None, keyword: str | None = None, decade: int | None = None, publishing_country: str | None = None, hosting_country: str | None = None, license: str | None = None, project_id: str | None = None, taxon_key: int | None = None, record_count: str | None = None, modified_date: str | None = None, doi: str | None = None, network_key: str | None = None, endorsing_node_key: str | None = None, installation_key: str | None = None, endpoint_type: str | None = None, query: str | None = None, highlight: bool | None = None, facet: list | None = None, facet_min_count: int | None = None, facet_multiselect: bool | None = None, facet_limit: int | None = None, facet_offset: int | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns datasets matching the search parameters. Full-text search across all datasets. Results are ordered by relevance.

Parameters:

  • dataset_type (str) – The primary type of the dataset. Available values : OCCURRENCE, CHECKLIST, METADATA, SAMPLING_EVENT, MATERIAL_ENTITY.

  • subtype (str) – The sub-type of the dataset. Available values : TAXONOMIC_AUTHORITY, NOMENCLATOR_AUTHORITY, INVENTORY_THEMATIC, INVENTORY_REGIONAL, GLOBAL_SPECIES_DATASET, DERIVED_FROM_OCCURRENCE, SPECIMEN, OBSERVATION.

  • publishing_org (str) – Filters datasets by their publishing organization UUID key.

  • hosting_org (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization UUID key.

  • keyword (str) – Filters datasets by a case insensitive plain text keyword. The search is done on the merged collection of tags, the dataset keywordCollections and temporalCoverages.

  • decade (int) – Filters datasets by their temporal coverage broken down to decades. Decades are given as a full year, e.g. 1880, 1960, 2000, etc, and will return datasets wholly contained in the decade as well as those that cover the entire decade or more. Facet by decade to get the break down, i.e. facet=DECADE&limit=0.

  • publishing_country (str) – Filters datasets by their owning organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • hosting_countrg (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • license (str) – The dataset’s licence. Available values : CC0_1_0, CC_BY_4_0, CC_BY_NC_4_0, UNSPECIFIED, UNSUPPORTED.

  • project_id (str) – Filter or facet based on the project ID of a given dataset. A dataset can have a project id if it is the result of a project. multiple datasets can have the same project id. Example : AA003-AA003311F.

  • taxon_key (int) – A taxon key from the GBIF backbone.

  • record_count (int) – Number of records of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 100,*.

  • modified_date (str) – Date when the dataset was modified the last time. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 2022-05-01,*.

  • doi (str) – A DOI identifier.

  • network_key (str) – Network associated to a dataset.

  • endorsing_node_key (str) – Node key that endorsed this dataset’s publisher.

  • installation_key (str) – Key (uuid) of the installation that hosts the dataset.

  • endpoint_type (str) – Type of the endpoint of the dataset. Available values : EML, FEED, WFS, WMS, TCS_RDF, TCS_XML, DWC_ARCHIVE, DIGIR, DIGIR_MANIS, TAPIR, BIOCASE, BIOCASE_XML_ARCHIVE, OAI_PMH, COLDP, CAMTRAP_DP, OTHER.

  • query (str) – Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • highlight (bool) – Set highlight=True to highlight terms matching the query when in fulltext search fields. The highlight will be an emphasis tag of class gbifHl.

  • facet (list) – A facet name used to retrieve the most frequent values for a field. This parameter may be repeated to request multiple facets.

  • facet_min_count (int) – Used in combination with the facet parameter. Set facet_min_count={#} to exclude facets with a count less than {#}.

  • facet_multiselect (bool) – Used in combination with the facet parameter. Set facet_multiselect=True to still return counts for values that are not currently filtered.

  • facet_limt (int) – Facet parameters allow paging requests using the parameters facet_offset and facet_limit.

  • facet_offset (int) – Facet parameters allow paging requests using the parameters facet_offset and facet_limit.

  • limit (int) – Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the datasets matching search criteria.

Return type:

dict

suggest_datasets(dataset_type: str | None = None, subtype: str | None = None, publishing_org: str | None = None, hosting_org: str | None = None, keyword: str | None = None, decade: int | None = None, publishing_country: str | None = None, hosting_country: str | None = None, license: str | None = None, project_id: str | None = None, taxon_key: int | None = None, record_count: str | None = None, modified_date: str | None = None, doi: str | None = None, network_key: str | None = None, endorsing_node_key: str | None = None, installation_key: str | None = None, endpoint_type: str | None = None, query: str | None = None)[source]

Search that returns up to 20 matching datasets. Results are ordered by relevance. The response is smaller than a dataset search.

Parameters:

  • dataset_type (str) – The primary type of the dataset. Available values : OCCURRENCE, CHECKLIST, METADATA, SAMPLING_EVENT, MATERIAL_ENTITY.

  • subtype (str) – The sub-type of the dataset. Available values : TAXONOMIC_AUTHORITY, NOMENCLATOR_AUTHORITY, INVENTORY_THEMATIC, INVENTORY_REGIONAL, GLOBAL_SPECIES_DATASET, DERIVED_FROM_OCCURRENCE, SPECIMEN, OBSERVATION.

  • publishing_org (str) – Filters datasets by their publishing organization UUID key.

  • hosting_org (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization UUID key.

  • keyword (str) – Filters datasets by a case insensitive plain text keyword. The search is done on the merged collection of tags, the dataset keywordCollections and temporalCoverages.

  • decade (int) – Filters datasets by their temporal coverage broken down to decades. Decades are given as a full year, e.g. 1880, 1960, 2000, etc, and will return datasets wholly contained in the decade as well as those that cover the entire decade or more. Facet by decade to get the break down, i.e. facet=DECADE&limit=0.

  • publishing_country (str) – Filters datasets by their owning organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • hosting_countrg (str) – Filters datasets by their hosting organization’s country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • license (str) – The dataset’s licence. Available values : CC0_1_0, CC_BY_4_0, CC_BY_NC_4_0, UNSPECIFIED, UNSUPPORTED.

  • project_id (str) – Filter or facet based on the project ID of a given dataset. A dataset can have a project id if it is the result of a project. multiple datasets can have the same project id. Example : AA003-AA003311F.

  • taxon_key (int) – A taxon key from the GBIF backbone.

  • record_count (int) – Number of records of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 100,*.

  • modified_date (str) – Date when the dataset was modified the last time. Accepts ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard. Example : 2022-05-01,*.

  • doi (str) – A DOI identifier.

  • network_key (str) – Network associated to a dataset.

  • endorsing_node_key (str) – Node key that endorsed this dataset’s publisher.

  • installation_key (str) – Key (uuid) of the installation that hosts the dataset.

  • endpoint_type (str) – Type of the endpoint of the dataset. Available values : EML, FEED, WFS, WMS, TCS_RDF, TCS_XML, DWC_ARCHIVE, DIGIR, DIGIR_MANIS, TAPIR, BIOCASE, BIOCASE_XML_ARCHIVE, OAI_PMH, COLDP, CAMTRAP_DP, OTHER.

  • query (str) – Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • Returns – dict: A dictionary containing dataset suggestions.

update_dataset()[source]

  • doi_suffix (str) – The DOI suffix.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

library_of_life.registry.institutions module

class library_of_life.registry.institutions.Institutions(use_caching=False, cache_name='institutions_cache', backend='sqlite', expire_after=3600, auth_type='basic', client_id=None, client_secret=None, token_url=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for interacting with the institutions section of the Registry API.

endpoint

The endpoint for this section of the API.

export_institutions(data_format='TSV', institution_type: str | None = None, institutional_governance: str | None = None, disciplines: str | None = None, code: str | None = None, name: str | None = None, alternative_code: str | None = None, contact: str | None = None, machine_tag_namespace: str | None = None, machine_tag_name: str | None = None, machine_tag_value: str | None = None, identifier_type: str | None = None, identifier: str | None = None, country: str | None = None, gbif_region: str | None = None, city: str | None = None, fuzzy_name: str | None = None, active: bool | None = None, master_source_type: str | None = None, number_specimens: str | None = None, display_on_nhc_portal: bool | None = None, replaced_by: str | None = None, occurrence_count: str | None = None, type_specimen_count: str | None = None, institution_key: str | None = None, sort_by: str | None = None, sort_order: str | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns full text results of institutions search.

Parameters:

  • data_format (str) – Available values: TSV and CSV. Default is TSV.

  • institution_type (str) – Optional. Type of a GrSciColl institution. Available values : BIOMEDICAL_RESEARCH_INSTITUTE, BOTANICAL_GARDEN, HERBARIUM, LIVING_ORGANISM_COLLECTION, MEDICAL_RESEARCH_INSTITUTE, MUSEUM, MUSEUM_HERBARIUM_PRIVATE_NON_PROFIT, OTHER_INSTITUTIONAL_TYPE, OTHER_TYPE_RESEARCH_INSTITUTION_BIOREPOSITORY, UNIVERSITY_COLLEGE, ZOO_AQUARIUM.

  • institutional_governance (str) – Optional. Instutional governance of a GrSciColl institution. Available values : ACADEMIC_FEDERAL, ACADEMIC_FOR_PROFIT, ACADEMIC_LOCAL, ACADEMIC_NON_PROFIT, ACADEMIC_STATE, FEDERAL, FOR_PROFIT, LOCAL, NON_PROFIT, OTHER, STATE.

  • disciplines (str) – Optional. Discipline of a GrSciColl institution. Accepts multiple values, for example discipline=ARCHAEOLOGY_PREHISTORIC&discipline=ARCHAEOLOGY_HISTORIC. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • code (str) – Optional. Code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • name (str) – Optional. Name of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • alternative_code (str) – Optional. Alternative code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • contact (str) – Optional. Filters collections and institutions whose contacts contain the person key specified.

  • machine_tag_namespace (str) – Optional: Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • identifier_type (str) – Optional. An identifier type for the identifier parameter. Available values : URL, LSID, HANDLER, DOI, UUID, FTP, URI, UNKNOWN, GBIF_PORTAL, GBIF_NODE, GBIF_PARTICIPANT, GRSCICOLL_ID, GRSCICOLL_URI, IH_IRN, ROR, GRID, CITES, SYMBIOTA_UUID, WIKIDATA, NCBI_BIOCOLLECTION.

  • identifier (str) – Optional. An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

  • country (str) – Optional. Filters by country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • gbif_region (str) – Optional. Filters by a gbif region. Available values : AFRICA, ASIA, EUROPE, NORTH_AMERICA, OCEANIA, LATIN_AMERICA, ANTARCTICA.

  • city (str) – Optional. Filters by the city of the address. It searches in both the physical and the mailing address.

  • fuzzy_name (str) – Optional. It searches by name fuzzily so the parameter doesn’t have to be the exact name.

  • active (bool) – Optional. Active status of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • master_source_type (str) – Optional. The master source type of a GRSciColl institution or collection. Available values : GRSCICOLL, GBIF_REGISTRY, IH.

  • number_specimens (str) – Optional. Number of specimens. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • display_on_nhc_portal (bool) – Optional. Flag to show this record in the NHC portal.

  • replaced_by (str) – Optional. Key of the entity that replaced another entity.

  • occurrence_count (str) – Optional. Count of occurrences linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • type_specimen_count (str) – Optional. Count of type specimens linked. It supports ranges and a ‘*’ can be used as a wildcard.

  • institution_key (str) – Optional. Keys of institutions to filter by.

  • sort_by (str) – Optional. Field to sort the results by. It only supports the fields contained in the enum. Available values : NUMBER_SPECIMENS.

  • sort_order (str) – Optional. Sort order to use with the sortBy parameter. Available values : ASC, DESC.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

The full text results of the institutions search.

Return type:

TSV or CSV

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns

search_institutions_and_collections(country, query: str | None = None, highlight: bool | None = None, entity_type: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns data on collections and institutions matching the search parameters.

Parameters:

  • country (str) – Required. The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • highlight (bool) – Optional. Set hl=true to highlight terms matching the query when in fulltext search fields. The highlight will be an emphasis tag of class gbifHl.

  • entity_type (str) – Optional. Code of a GrSciColl institution or collection.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing data about collections and institutions.

Return type:

dict

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • modified (str) – Optional. The modified date of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘’ can be used as a wildcard, e.g.:modified=2023-04-01,

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

library_of_life.registry.tech_installations module

class library_of_life.registry.tech_installations.TechnicalInstallations(use_caching=False, cache_name='installations_cache', backend='sqlite', expire_after=3600, auth_type='basic', client_id=None, client_secret=None, token_url=None)[source]

A class for interacting with the technical installations section of the Registry API.

endpoint

The endpoint for this section of the API.

get_installation_by_key(key)[source]

Returns details of a single installation matching the given key.

Parameters:

key (str) – The key of the entity (dataset, organization, network etc.).

Returns:

Returns details of a single installation.

Return type:

dict

list_all_installations(installation_type: str | None = None, identifier_type: str | None = None, identifier: str | None = None, machine_tag_namespace: str | None = None, machine_tag_name: str | None = None, machine_tag_value: str | None = None, modified: str | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Returns a list of all current installations (deleted installations are not listed).

Parameters:

  • installation_type (str) – Filter by the type of installation. Available values : IPT_INSTALLATION, DIGIR_INSTALLATION, TAPIR_INSTALLATION, BIOCASE_INSTALLATION, HTTP_INSTALLATION, SYMBIOTA_INSTALLATION, EARTHCAPE_INSTALLATION

  • identifier_type (str) – Optional. An identifier type for the identifier parameter. Available values : URL, LSID, HANDLER, DOI, UUID, FTP, URI, UNKNOWN, GBIF_PORTAL, GBIF_NODE, GBIF_PARTICIPANT, GRSCICOLL_ID, GRSCICOLL_URI, IH_IRN, ROR, GRID, CITES, SYMBIOTA_UUID, WIKIDATA, NCBI_BIOCOLLECTION.

  • identifier (str) – Optional. An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

  • machine_tag_namespace (str) – Optional: Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

  • machine_tag_name (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

  • machine_tag_value (str) – Optional. Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

  • modified (str) – Optional. The modified date of the dataset. Accepts ranges and a ‘’ can be used as a wildcard, e.g.:modified=2023-04-01,

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a list of installations.

Return type:

dict
